Description: One pendant and nine beads in different shapes and materials. A: One pendant roughly in the shape of a drop with several flat sides, made of a whitish stone, the base is rounded but shows some edges. B: One larger disc-shaped bead made of ostrich eggshell, the surface is quite eroded and shows pitting as if it was used as a base for further drilling. C: One smaller disc-shaped bead made of a vivid turquoise faience. D: Four segmented cylindrical beads made of faience, two of them show faint traces of light blue glaze. E: Three extended spherical beads with a wide ridge in the middle of the lateral face. One in a light green, two in a white faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2, AA (F), LIII
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
